sen.j: 野々村仁清（ののむら にんせい、生没年不詳）は、江戸時代前期の陶工。
sen.e: Ninsei NONOMURA (野々村仁清: date of birth and date of death are unknown) is a potter in the early Edo Period.
Ninsei NONOMURA (野々村仁清: date of birth and date of death are unknown) is a potter in the early Edo Period.
Ninsei NONOMURA (野々村仁清: date of birth and date of death are unknown) is a potter in the early Edo Period.
His popular name is Seiemon.
His popular name is Seiemon.
His popular name is Seiemon.
He is a distinguished craftsman of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art) earthenware with multicolored overgraze enamels.
He is a distinguished craftsman of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art) earthenware with multicolored overgraze enamels.
He is a distinguished craftsman of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art) earthenware with multicolored overgraze enamels.

sen.j: 丹波国桑田郡野々村（現・京都府南丹市美山町旧大野村）の生まれ。
sen.e: He was born at Nonomura Village, Kuwata-gun, Tanba Province (present, Miyama-cho Tawn (former Onomura Village), Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture).
He was born at Nonomura Village, Kuwata-gun, Tanba Province (present, Miyama-cho Tawn (former Onomura Village), Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture).
He was born at Nonomura Village, Kuwata-gun, Tanba Province (present, Miyama-cho Tawn (former Onomura Village), Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 若い頃は粟田口や瀬戸で陶芸の修業をしたといわれ、のち京都に戻り、御室（おむろ）仁和寺の門前に窯を開いた。
sen.e: It is said that when he was young, he got his training in pottery at Awataguchi and Seto, and later he returned to Kyoto and built his own kiln in front of the Omuro Ninna-ji Temple.
It is said that when he was young, he got his training in pottery at Awataguchi and Seto, and later he returned to Kyoto and built his own kiln in front of the Omuro Ninna-ji Temple.
It is said that when he was young, he got his training in pottery at Awataguchi and Seto, and later he returned to Kyoto and built his own kiln in front of the Omuro Ninna-ji Temple.

sen.j: 中世以前の陶工は無名の職人にすぎなかったが、仁清は自分の作品に「仁清」の印を捺し、これが自分の作品であることを宣言した。
sen.e: Before the Middle Ages, potters were nothing but nameless artisans, however, he placed a seal of his name 'Ninsei' to his works to announce that they are his own works.
Before the Middle Ages, potters were nothing but nameless artisans, however, he placed a seal of his name 'Ninsei' to his works to announce that they were his own works.
Before the Middle Ages, potters were nothing but nameless artisans, however, he placed a seal of his name 'Ninsei' to his works to announce that they were his own works.

sen.j: そうした意味で、仁清は近代的な意味での「作家」「芸術家」としての意識をもった最初期の陶工であるといえよう。
sen.e: In that context, it can be said that Ninsei is the first potter who had a sense of 'creator' or 'artist' in modern meaning.
In that context, it can be said that Ninsei was the first potter who had a sense of being a 'creator' or 'artist' according to the modern meaning.
In that context, it can be said that Ninsei was the first potter who had a sense of being a 'creator' or 'artist' according to the modern meaning.

sen.j: 仁清は特に轆轤（ろくろ）の技に優れたといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that Ninsei was especially good at managing a potter's wheel.
It is said that Ninsei was especially good at managing a potter's wheel.
It is said that Ninsei was especially good at managing a potter's wheel.

sen.j: 現存する茶壺などを見ても、大振りの作品を破綻なく均一な薄さに挽きあげる轆轤技には感嘆させられる。
sen.e: The existent tea-leaf jars show his impressively refined wheel technique to make a big-sized work with thin uniformed thickness walls without failing.
The existent tea-leaf jars show his impressively refined wheel technique to make a big-sized work with thin uniformed thickness walls without fail..
The existent tea-leaf jars show his impressively refined wheel technique to make a big-sized work with thin uniformed thickness walls without fail.
sen.cmt: 最後のピリオドを一つ削除。

sen.j: また、有名な「色絵雉香炉」や「法螺貝形香炉」のような彫塑的な作品にも優れている。
sen.e: He was also good at sculptural works such as 'Iro-e Kiji Koro' (Incense burner in the shape of pheasant decorated with overgraze enamels) and 'Horagai-gata KORO' ('Incense burner in the form of a conch shell).
sen.cmt: 「色絵雉香炉」'Iro-e Kiji Koro' (Incense burner in the shape of pheasant decorated with overgraze enamels) [http://www.ishibi.pref.ishikawa.jp/syozou/sakuhin_detail.php？SakuNo=01000100] 「法螺貝形香炉」'Horagai-gata KORO' ('Incense burner in the form of a conch shell) [http://www.cam.ac.uk/vastatic/microsites/1159_grand_design/popup.php?img_id=233]
sen.e: He was also good at sculptural works such as 'Iro-e Kiji Koro' (Incense burner in the shape of pheasant decorated with overgraze enamels) and 'Horagai-gata KORO' ('Incense burner in the form of a conch shell).

He was also good at sculptural works such as 'Iro-e Kiji Koro' (Incense burner in the shape of pheasant decorated with overgraze enamels) and 'Horagai-gata KORO' ('Incense burner in the form of a conch shell).

sen.j: 現存する仁清作の茶壺は、立体的な器面という画面を生かし、金彩・銀彩を交えた色絵で華麗な絵画的装飾を施している。
sen.e: The existent tea-leaf jars by Ninsei are stereoscopically decorated on the all the facet of the ceramics, with picturesque gorgeous illustrations painted with the multicolored overgraze enamels including the pigments of gold and silver.

The existent tea-leaf jars by Ninsei are stereoscopically decorated on the all the facet of the ceramics, with picturesque gorgeous illustrations painted with the multicolored overgraze enamels including the pigments of gold and silver.

The existent tea-leaf jars by Ninsei are stereoscopically decorated on the all the facet of the ceramics, with picturesque gorgeous illustrations painted with the multicolored overgraze enamels including the pigments of gold and silver.
